article.headline: Albertsons stock rises after earnings beat
article.body: Albertsons Cos. Inc. ACI, +1.71% stock rose nearly 1% in Monday premarket trading after the grocer reported first-quarter earnings that beat expectations. This is Albertsons' first earnings announcement since going public in June. Net income totaled $586.2 million, or $1 per share, up from $49.0 million, or 8 cents per share, last year. Adjusted EPS of $1.35 beat the FactSet consensus for $1.32. Revenue totaled $22.75 billion, up from $18.74 billion but just below the FactSet consensus for $22.79 billion. Digital sales soared 276%. Same-store sales grew 26.5%. Albertsons attributed the revenue increase to the same-store sales increase, but says it was offset by store closures and lower fuel sales. COVID-19-related investments totaled $615 million, including more than $275 million in additional pay for frontline workers. Albertsons did not provide financial guidance due to uncertainty related to the coronavirus pandemic. Albertsons stock has gained 4.3% over the past month while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87% has rallied nearly 7%.
